I got some relatively good reception on MITB, so I figure I would try my luck here. Feedback on the tutorial is appreciated. Thanks. Today I will be covering all the basic details on jQuery; what it is, why you should use it and how to use it! Let us begin. [CENTER][B][U][SIZE=4]What is jQuery?[/SIZE][/U][/B][/CENTER] [SIZE=2]jQuery is a JavaScript library known as a 'Write Less, Do More' way for Javascript developers to develop modern Web 2.0 functionality in their webpages. jQuery is a powerful library which has all the possibilities of programming with bare Javascript. jQuery is a Javascript file in itself which web developers use in various ways, in this tutorial we will be covering downloading this file on your server and calling it from there.[/SIZE] [SIZE=2]The inner workings of jQuery may be complex to some unrecognized with the [I]Document Object Model[/I]. In a nutshell, the DOM contains data about the content on a webpage. The DOM has various nodes which is whats called the [I]Document Hierarchy[/I]. This hierarchy spawns many different nodes that correspond to different aspects of a web document, including nodes that correspond to the various tags such as anchors, images and so on. Here is a neat picture of the document hierarchy;[/SIZE] [CENTER][IMG]http://w3schools.com/htmldom/htmltree.gif[/img][/CENTER] jQuery has an extremely similar structure. A jQuery node is basically an object that extends functionality to a regular DOM node. Any element listed in the DOM can be modified as a jQuery node, which is quite a powerful capability. [CENTER][B][U][SIZE=4]Why use jQuery?[/SIZE][/U][/B][/CENTER] [SIZE=2]Using jQuery opens up many possibilities which would be much harder to implement in regular Javascript. People tend to use jQuery for quick and easy page content such as adding tabs, accordions, dialogues and many more. jQuery is an "extended Javascript" to most.[/SIZE] [SIZE=2]Let's begin with actually using jQuery. You can download the latest version here,[/SIZE] [URL=http://docs.jquery.com/Downloading_jQuery#Download_jQuery]http://docs.jquery.com/Downloading_jQuery#Download_jQuery[/URL] Make sure you download the .js file. Next, place the file on your server for other pages to access. Pretty basic stuff if you ask me. As of this writting the file is [I]jquery-1.4.2.min.js[/I]. Using the library is the same as using any other regular Javascript library or external file. In your [I][/I] tag define the following; [code][/code] That assumes the file is in the same directory as the webpages you will be using jQuery with. Beginning jQuery is quite simple. However you should know the basics of manipulating the DOM through regular Javascript. Creating a jQuery object is relatively easy. Using the [I]$()[/I] function you can create a new jQuery object. You can define a variable to hold an object like so, [code]var jQueryObj = $("#random-id-here");[/code] That is the same as doing, [code]var DOMObj = document.getElementById("random-id-here");[/code] Easy right? You also dont have to specify a variable everytime you want to create a new jQuery object. Say for example you wanted a snippet that changes the contents of any HTML data in an element with an id named [I]output[/I]. Simple, [code]$("#output").html("Changing HTML with the html function!");[/code] The [I]html()[/I] function basically works the same way as the [I]innerHTML[/I] property in regular DOM scripting.
